text: Prequel means before and sequel means continuing. I don't know what it's called when it's in the middle. What I'm trying to say is that I want to write a comic on what happened during the Xenosaga series. There's been many things that's been left out and lots of fans questioned and wondered what happened from the beginning, in the middle, and the end. I'm not saying it's official but I would like to write a story basically on what happened. For example, when the Durandal was being assaulted unexpectedly they first showed a scene where the soldiers were taking down the people of the Durandal and a soldier kicked a woman on the floor and the screen went dark and there was a gunshot. Now we all know that the soldier shot the woman, they just didn't show it, but according to me she wasn't shot. The gun shot was from my made character who actually shot the soldier and told the woman to flee. And another scene according to the gameplay Mary and Shelley were separated, but no one knows why. Again according to me, Dimitri heard a lot of gunshots and men screaming and of course my made character came in for the rescue but he was caught in a fight with Citrine. But in the meantime Dimitri told the soldiers to separate Mary and Shelley and to guard them, assuming that my character was there for them and that he'll deal with him
author: Ray Shabaz

text: something that takes place at the same time as another thing is called a sidequel apparently
author: markasscop Arev

text: @markasscop Arev I appreciate that, thanks. So far what do you think of that plot so far? If you don't understand it then look at the cutscene of the Durandal being assaulted by soldiers
author: Ray Shabaz

text:
@Ray Shabaz I'm not much of a fanfiction person but I think it works, I disliked how that woman was implied to have been killed in cold blood so there's certainly room for your story to slip in to counter that
I agree that separating shelly and mary was a bit random though

author: Sephiko

text: Anyone who played Xenogears will recognize the theme Kajiura built upon for this track, One Who Bares Fangs at God (Xenogears' final boss theme by Mitsuda). Kajiura did a great job﻿ with this, adding a nice melody and retaining a good ambient feel. This really took me by surprise when I played this game and got to this dungeon, couldn't help but smile. The Xeno series probably has one of my favorite VG stories of all time. Too bad it's pretty much dead now.
